p: The most common behavioural eligibility criterion that was met was engaging in receptive CLAI with casual partners (6.1% to 15.5% of the estimated gay men population), and the second most common criterion was a diagnosis of an anal bacterial STI or syphilis in the last 12 months (4.9% to 10.6%). Depending on frequency of use, only 1.4% to 9.4% of gay men were eligible for PrEP based on crystal use. The prevalence of all these practices in men not on PrEP has been increasing in the past years and may increase in the future, particularly if PrEP use is associated with increasing CLAI with casual partners [ 25].
